p: Nowcast point estimates tracked the ILI time series well for both approaches, though point estimates had greater error by all measures for the NobBS approach (NobBS rRMSE = 0.074 vs. HH rRMSE = 0.062; Table 1). However, the NobBS approach produced considerably wider prediction intervals (Figs 1C and 2C) resulting in both higher scores (NobBS average score = 0.218 vs. HH average score = 0.017) and 100% coverage by the 95% prediction intervals compared to 0% coverage for the HH ( Table 1). We observed that at multiple deciles of the prediction interval, the interval provided conservative coverage, but that the calibration of narrower intervals was better ( S1 Fig).
